author: FrozenFlame
content:
Couldn't agree more. SWF leading up to the creation of Dgames as a separate subforum from Forum Games and then for a couple years thereafter was by far the most competitive mafia community I've ever played in. Not that MS here doesn't have quality players, but on SWF there was very little low level play and thus the overall quality of play was not at all diluted. Unfortunately, just by virtue of the much larger community size here, that dilution phenomenon takes place here and in many other communities.

SWF just had sooooo many heavy hitters and they would always be in games together by virtue of the fact that high level players were the plurality of players. I remember the golden age of Dgames very fondly. So many great personalities with intellect and a competitive mindset to boot. Not all that surprising considering most people who take smash bros games seriously enough to join and actively post on a site devoted almost entirely to competitive play are going to bring that same mindset to mafia. The nature of smashboards itself was self selecting for people who enjoy learning games with depth and take playing to wincon seriously.

author: nancy
content:
How to play a nancy gameSpoiler: BASICS 1 ~ Site rules apply obv.
2 ~ Don't quote from mod communication or PTs.
3 ~ Don't communicate about this game outside of the game thread except as allowed by mod. Don't discuss other ongoing games.
4 ~ Don't edit.
5 ~ Any potential conduct violations not listed in the ruleset will be subject to mod discretion.

Spoiler: ME & MINI 6 ~ Fun is mandatory. You are not allowed to not have fun. Not having fun includes, among other things, yelling or cursing at other players or at yourself, being mean-spirited or uncivil, disrespecting other players or yourself, and feeling traumatized by any happenings in-game. Mod warnings may occur in severe cases of not having fun.
7 ~ Use of slurs or any kind of derogatory or inflammatory language is absolutely never okay.
8 ~ To reiterate: toxicity is not welcome and will not be tolerated. Please be civil and respectful.
9 ~ Problems will be solved by discussion first, potential action only if necessary. PM the mod with any questions, concerns, crises, complaints, or deliberations.
10 ~ Mod!nancy reserves the right to use the color DeepSkyBlue. Backupmod!Mini will use DeepPink. Don't pretend to be us.
11 ~ Attract the mods' attention by using @mods, fat words or PM.
12 ~ No provable randomness, nor encryption, nor hidden or tiny (size <75) text, nor any other remotely unsportswomanlike gaming in thread.
13 ~ English language only, lo siento.
14 ~ Thou shalt not bah.
15 ~ Shitposting is not allowed in the game thread.
16 ~ Mod skin is mafBlack.

Spoiler: ACTIVITY 17 ~ Don't be inactive m'kay? â™¥
18 ~ Prods after 48 hours, replacement 24 hours following if not picked up. I'll replace you after 3 prods.
19 ~ PM the mod or notify her in thread for V/LA or to request replacement.
20 ~ Deadlines are 14 by Day, 48 by Night.
21 ~ Deadline extensions or skips may be granted upon consensus request where appropriate.

Spoiler: MECHANICS 22 ~ Approved for normalcy and balance by my generous review team.
23 ~ Confirmed 10:3 distribution.
24 ~ NAR in use.
25 ~ Majority lynches. If no majority is achieved by deadline, No Lynch occurs by default.
26 ~ One slot may not perform factional and player actions simultaneously.

Credit to Nadhia and mhsmith0 for ruleset.

Spoiler: SAMPLE ROLE PM Hello <player> and welcome to Girls â™¥ Girls Mini 1909! You are a VANILLA TOWNIE.

You win when all threats to Town are eliminated.

[url]Game thread[/url]. Please confirm via PM with role name and alignment before posting in thread.

Have fun!

author: nancy
content:
FLAVORSpoiler: Day 1 nancy smiles up at the sky for a moment as she leaves her apartment building. The color of morning has everything lit up and sparkling and the smell of purple hyacinth carries her out into the side street. She taps out a message on her phone keyboard as she strolls down along the vacant sidewalk with her bag slung over one shoulder, Am otw!.
A few blabbering tourists crowd around the barred gates to Casa di Giulietta. The way becomes still busier once nancy reaches the piazza beyond. Local women dressed in all manner of color and fashion hurry this way and that with their eyes buried in smartphone screens.
Someone curses at themselves sheepishly and appears without recourse when they stumble on a curb and spill their takeaway coffee onto their hand. nancy's phone comes to life in her coat pocket with a message: Hurrry uuuuuuppp.
nancy ducks into a bar for a moment to snatch an angel wing and a coffee before continuing on her way. /me licks, she sends. The pastry melts against her tongue as she rounds a corner and she nearly sags against the wall for a moment under the effect of the sugar.
nancy's phone buzzes mutely against her hip. She purrs at the sight of the little words on the screen: Would be perfect if I only had something fuzzy in my lap to cuddle right now. Her response is a jumble of cat emoji and meowing. Another message pops up as she crosses the piazza under the watch of Torre dei Lamberti.
nancy there are flights on sale to GÃ¶teborg!
YESSSSSSSS OMG WHEN BUY THEM BUY THEM. The thought of going back to Sweden makes nancy's toes curl. That was where everything had started....
A bird perches on a balcony railing above nancy takes into flight at the sight of a possible mate, and nancy's phone screen glows with the winding back-and-forth between her and her lover as she cuts across the city.
Umm would you be mad at me if I told you I ate the last of the chocolate last night? ;~;
Mini puts her phone aside for a moment to stare up at the ceiling, trying intently to calm her fidgeting. She's been lying on her bed for over an hour with the pillows gathered around her, spamming nancy's phone with messages and never receiving enough in reply. The incense on her dresser has died, but she hasn't noticed. She's too wrapped up in her impatience, waiting for nancy to arrive while warding off the swells of pain coursing up her back through to her forehead.

The distance between their houses is easily walkable, but the amount of time it takes to travel when there is nothing else to focus on drives Mini to rearranging the bed in every manner possible. After tossing the triangular pillow back against the head of the bed once again, she switches to Skyscanner app at a whim and checks for flights to Sweden. A moment later she flurries through a jumble of texts to nancy, only the first coming through with proper diction: nancy there are flights on sale to GÃ¶teborg!

~

In the brief surge of excitement at reading the message, nancy stops watching the path for just long enough to collide with a woman hurrying out of a store bearing a carrybag full of groceries nestled in the crook of her elbow. The force of the impact sends the bag swinging and its contents half-spill out onto the stone paving: several tomatoes, a punnet of strawberries, an orange, and a jar of pickles. The jar shatters and spews pickle and preservative across nancy's textile shoes.
Spoiler: Day 2 The sun is climbing high enough over old, red-topped Verona to begin to fill the sky. The soft glow that filters through the clouds embarks upon its slow journey of clearing the dampness of the city streets. On Via Pillicciai, nancy glances regretfully at the closed doors of Come una Volta as she passes the gelateria at a brisk walk. She now has a new route to Mini's house, detouring by Via Mazzini on account of Mini's evening snacking habits, nevermind her shoes being completely ruinedâ€”the smell of pickle drags itself around with her everywhere, a plague upon her and anyone else with a sensitive enough sense of smell to catch the odor. The streets are steadily filling and motorbikes have begun zipping by with increasing frequency. Here and there a little pool of water that has collected over the course of the night is dispersed across the pavement, and nancy more than once has to predict the movement of traffic to avoid being sprayed.

She finishes typing another messageâ€”an incoherent jumble of lovehearts and smileysâ€”and sends it to Mini. A ray of light burns through a window (she thinks for a moment that it is the sun) and she squints against it as she moves to retrieve her sunglasses from her bag. The sound of traffic becomes unbearable as a truck trundles by, running through a puddle and sending a slur of muck in nancy's direction. She dodges backwards instinctively at the sound of wheel hitting water, twisting her body away from the turbulence of brownish liquid in her periphery, and trips over a terrier squatting patiently by its leash. For a moment the ground seems to be surging unstoppably up towards her, before it falters and halts and she realizes that she has caught herself with one hand gripping the flat stone of the building, and is stumbling to regain her balance. She forgets that the dog exists as she recovers shiveringly from the panic of the near-fall, starts once again down the street at a stilted gait, and stares without recognition at the pair of blue sunglasses in her hand, frame and lens crumpled and cracked from their meeting with the wall.
Um can go by Venchi to get more if you want? She slides the phone back into her jacket pocket just as a motorbike passes her. The man riding it calls out to her, bella gnocca!, and is taken around a corner. She spits his compliment into the pavement without breaking stride.
Somewhere nearby there is a cello playing, accompanied by clarinet and bassoon. The cello moves into recitative, and nancy glides across the intersection. Her phone hums silently as she passes under the building where she and her first girlfriend used to live, a small flat with a bedroom that always caught the afternoon sun in such a way to divide the room into two neat halves, one shimmering with thousandfold delight and the other cold and withdrawn.
nancy pictures herself at Mini's as she continues down the tunnel: she combs her fingers through Mini's hair, feels the tug of every strand and the soft surface of her scalp, and holds herself close to her body in search of her heartbeat as they lie in bed together watching a film (Kyss Mig, probably), surrounded by pillows and blankets and chocolate and incense. The imagined scene is so familiar it feels almost a memory. She quickens her step.
nancy glows as she walks by a lesbian couple locked in passionate embrace against the glass of a new dining establishment. The patrons on the interior side of the window gesticulate and shout noiselessly at the intrusion.
The wind picks up abruptly as nancy crosses the intersection coming out of the tunnel. Her hair blows across her face and blinds her until she can arrest it with her free hand. After getting it back under control on the safety of the sidewalk, she pulls it up and draws the elastic from her wrist to secure it in place. Just as she is tugging her hair through a second time there is a dull snap and the elastic comes loose in her fingers. Shit hot mess, she mutters. Now how I am going to keep my head tonight?

She fumbles with her smartphone. None of the buttons seem to cooperate at first, then she realizes that she's not using an iPhone anymore. You got elastic babe mine broke just now >_>
Spoiler: Day 3 A flush of emotion begins to bleed through nancy as she rounds the corner onto Via Catullo. The narrow laneway is mostly devoid of pedestrians and only a few vehicles occasion it. The storied buidlings that rise over the sidestreet give it a feeling of secluded privacy that is further heightened by immaculate display niches punctuating the walls. She walks in silence and touches the small posts that line the sidewalk, grazing her palm over the rounded tops in a daydream. The rhythm of her lover's voice in her mind carries her down the street as the slow crescendo of desire - for chocolate and for sex - overwhelms her in its swell.

How long can it take to reach the damn chocolate store.... I hate detours!
I missss youuuuu. I swear I'm having nance-withdrawal symptoms right now. Where are youuu??
Past the spotty yellow facades, the red clay walls and the ornate doors, under shuttered windows and the overhanging balconies with their sharp, black railing, by the display fronts and the little poles marking the way safe for pedestrians, nancy closes in on the intersection of Via Catullo and Mazzini. She mulls over all the variety of flavors of chocolate as she walks, in anticipation of reaching Venchi, and fails to notice her phone making a fuss in her coat pocket. As she reaches the intersection, she notices two women, dressed identically, in a heated discussion with a man by the corner. Their dispute abruptly descends into shouting, with the man braying that his rights and men's rights all over the world are being violating, that he is a victim of oppression in a culture "dominated by female manipulation". Tears begin rolling down his cheeks as the couple spit at his feet, turn heel and walk away. Ever a tourist of misandry and male tears, nancy savors the sight for a moment before moving on. Venchi, sweet heaven of chocolates, awaits.
Spoiler: Day 4 nancy stands at the entrance to Venchi for a moment, savoring the smell of chocolate wafting out from within. Customers mill around inside the store, indecisive and desperate. She types out another message to Mini at the threshold consisting of love hearts and a variety of chocolate-y emoji, then puts her phone back into her coat pocket and moves to step inside. A customer comes barrelling out the store just as she does, carrying hot chocolate somewhere in an explicable rush. The woman suddenly trips and falls, and her drink goes flying. The liquid streams onto nancy's coat in a hot, dark mess. She stares at her coat for a moment in disbeliefâ€”the pink, white and orange Ida Klamborn she bought back when she and Mini were traveling Sweden and falling in love with the country. Then at the woman lying, sprawled out on the pavement, with grazes on her arms.

First my shoes, then my sunglasses, now my coat.... Fuck! This couldn't get any worse!
AHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHH I'm comingggggggg sowwies ;~;
A moment of remembrance abruptly falls upon nancy as she waits her turn in Venchi with the stain of chocolate drying into her coat. She is reading the news on her phone and happens upon a piece describing the death of a man in the UK who had apparently been a serial online stalker. She notices by the pictures that he looks eerily similar to the photos she was sent by that creep who followed her across the Internet last year.

It had taken removing herself from social media and removing every trace of herself from the public that was she was able to finally begin to feel safe from him. How many emails had he sent her begging for attention, promising himself to her? How many times had he stalked her from one site to the next, somehow always managing to know her movements, for months invading her private life and never giving her a moment of peace?

And now he has apparently been murdered by one of the women he was stalking on and off for over four years. It is a horrible crime, but her feelings upon discovering the articleâ€”seeing his picture and reading his name over to herself to dispel her doubtâ€”is sheer relief. The moment passes and the memory of everything he has done to her empties completely from her mind. Her demeanor brightens with the knowledge that her persecutor now pays his dues in hell.
Spoiler: Day 5 The first time Mini and I kissed was in Gothenburg, outside the airport. It wasn't at all romantic on reflection, but it was so new that it kind of felt that way at the time. I remember it being a cool dayâ€”it was springâ€”with the sun out and I remember her wearing a blue and white polkadot dress and that her hair was done up in an elaborate braid that had partially come apart at the seams over the course of the flight. I'd warned her not to nap but she fell asleep anyway. I don't think she could help it, really. When we landed and got off the plane we were both so damn happy to be in Sweden finally that the wait for our baggage was the scarcely bareable peak of a crescendo that would only find release in the outdoors. We were stuck in international limbo, breathing in the stale air of disinfectant and airconditioning, with the actual Sweden, the fresh, oceanic air, still waiting for us, just out beyond the glass exit doors.

And when we made it outside there wasn't much else to do, really. We led our bags off the way and ran a circle then we were in each others arms hugging and she kissed my lids and my cheek then she kissed my lips and I was so completely gone from the bliss of it that there's just no way for me to ever forget that soft and elusive feeling of connectedness that I've since developed an addiction for or the flight leading up to it or the way that she smelled of lilac and the way that the outside smelled of dew and pollen and hibiscus (although the hibiscus may have just been someone walking by with a bouquet).

Diary excerpt dated May 8, 2013.

~

Do you remember our first kiss babe?
I think so yes!
When was it? I'm trying to remember and I can't ;~;
I think it was in GÃ¶teburg?
Really? Like the first time?
Yesss. At the airport
Ughh why can't I fucking remember :(
Inside Venchi, the neat displays of chocolate and the scent of cocoa and nut promptly melt nancy's resolve. She pounces on several items at once and carries them all to the counter: truffles, chocolate fingers, bars of dark and extra dark, plain, cherry-infused, with hazelnut, with chocolate filling, with caramelized orange, with chili and salt flakes. The pile fits neatly into a cute carrybag dressed in an ornate "V". She exits the heady ambience of the store, pursued by a sense of lingering regret.
nancy leaves Venchi and takes down Via Mazzini in a hurry, ignoring all the luxury shopping stores, thinking only of Mini's arms and lips. Tourists mill about outside the storefronts, peering in at the wares indecisively and gabbing with each other in foreign languages.

There are things that I'd like to be doing to you right now and you not being here is reaaally unhelpful.
I AM TRYING TO HURRY OKAY ;~;

The street turns into Piazza Bra and the arena, in full first-century splendor, overwhelms the scene. Cars and motorbikes busy the wide road and umbrellas tucked obediently into their sheaths decorate the sidewalk by the outdoor seating of restaurants and cafes. She turns quickly onto Piazzetta Rubiani then Via Cattaneo and is once more relatively alone on the late-morning sidestreet among the cracking paint of old walls and wire-hanging lamps. She sticks her hand into her coat pocket as the moves around a woman talking on her phone in a morning gown outside her door and feels the prick of an object she did not know was there.

She pulls the object out and realizes that it is the silver necklace with a half-moon pendant given to her by her first girlfriend all those years ago. nancy wonders for a moment whether her ex still has its twin, the other half of the moon, then lifts the lid of a garbage bin as she passes and drops the necklace inside.
Spoiler: Day 6 We were out in the woods and we'd been making out for a while by the fireplace and she â€”.

Diary excerpt dated February 4, 2013. (NSFW content redacted.)

~

Do you at least remember.... our first time?
No ;~;
....
A calico skitters out of nancy's way when she rounds the corner suddenly. She wilts in a moment of nostalgia over Summer, her own six year-old calico, who she had to leave in the care of friends when she left Sweden for Verona and MiniDeathStar.
She can still smell the chocolate as she makes the next blockâ€”only four more to Mini's placeâ€”and it only makes her salivating worse. /me has hungries
nancy rounds the corner to Mini's place. The street is in a state of relative quiet, and she begins to hurry with impatience. When she reaches the apartment door, she suddenly becomes aware that she no longer has her clutch with her. She checks herself in confusion for a moment and unpacks the carrybag full of chocolate before sighing with the realization that she must have left it back at Venchi. God fucking damn why has this has been such an awful morning?! She pulls out her phone and calls Mini to ask her to come down for her. She cries out as a sudden cramp crushes her and she curls up for a moment in an unsuccessful attempt to bear the pain.

Mini stutters in disbelief as she opens the door and sees the state her girlfriend is in. nancy breaks down with a desperate sob and buries her overflow of tears in Mini's shoulder.
First my FAVORITE PAIR OF SHOES, (Keyser SÃ¶ze, the pair of vegan, textile designer flats that she wears around the streets of Verona) got fucking ruined by a jar of pickles OF ALL THINGS.

Then my SUNGLASSES, (implosion, the pair of blue sunglasses with red-green-white patterning she bought from Agatha Ruiz de la Prada last Spring) which I loved and were fucking awesome, got CRUSHED against the wall because of that fucking rodent dog.

And after that my HAIR ELASTIC (Desperado, a simple thick black rubber hair band from the department store) snapped for no god damn reason and unless you have a decent one for me to use I have no way to keep my head tonight or I have to go all the way across town to get one.

At least I did get to see that god awful MRA PEDESTRIAN (Leonshade, an unmemorable men's rights activist who invariably nauseates women with his mansplaining and victim complex) take a beatdown from that lesbian couple. That was admittedly pretty delightful and enjoyed that for a good bit.

Except that the next thing I know my DESIGNER COAT (Aristophanes, the pink, white and orange coat she bought from Ida Klamborn when she and Mini were traveling together) got fucking destroyed by chocolate because that fucking girl can't watch where she's walking and had to spill her shit all over it. FUCK.

I did learn that my fucking ONLINE STALKER (camn, that fucking creeper she made the mistake of adding to social media last year who won't let up following her across the whole of the world wide web) got.... murdered.... which was.. good.. I guess. Fuck. I mean, that was a relief in a way?

But then the next thing I know I can't even remember our FIRST KISS (Nachomamma8, the memory of the kiss she shared with Mini outside the airport in Gothenburg), which is so fucking unbelievable that I tossed my ex's HALF-MOON NECKLACE (Titus, the necklace her first girlfriend gave her years ago for their first anniversary that she thought she had lost) into a random garbage bin on the way here and apparently also could not even remember my FIRST ORGASM WITH YOU, (Tammy, her memory of the first time she came in Mini's bed, eight days after they met) which just makes me hate myself completely because how the fuck can you forget that memory???? OF ALL THINGS.

Clearly I just have a fucking shit and worthless memory because I also forgot my CLUTCH PURSE, (Firebringer, the small, flame-red clutch adorned with four purple hearts that holds all her most valuable personal items, such as mace) at Venchi when I left there with the chocolate....

~

Mini pats nancy's hair as she recounts again the misfortunes she has suffered over the past hour or so on the way over when nancy suddenly tears herself away angrily and hurls her SMARTPHONE (Ginngie, the S8 she's been using the past two months to spam Mini with emoji and questionnaires) against the near wall. She screams sadly as fragments of smartphone explode against the wall, then glares in hysteria at Mini, pulls her VIAL OF MALE TEARS (Infinity 324, a small glass vial filled with every lesbian's most nutritious and savored meal.... may they never stop flowing) from her coat pocket and drains it onto the floor.

She doubles over in pain and seems on the brink of losing her balance as her PERIOD PAIN (Ser Arthur Dayne, the cramps that completely wreck her existence for several days each month) courses along her spine and through to the tips of her fingers and toes, quickly overwhelming and encompassing her entire body. Mini starts towards her hesitantly, with one arm outstretched, offering to help her upstairs to the apartment.

author: Nachomamma8
content:
With regards to RB, I'm sorry if you're genuinely frustrated - feeling like you're outside of a circle in a game can be unenjoyable but my most productive use of early game has always been interacting with people you know - sometimes you can catch odd interactions or odd vibes from people and make judgments on them when you're aware of their baseline - this is much more difficult for people you don't know. I have given reads that have nothing to do with meta - I'm not voting you because you're outside the circle (which should be obvious - I townread implosion for him having an opposite reaction to my circle jerk).

I can very much see this reaction being within his scum range and it seems way too overdone to be coming from town - a bit of initial frustration or an offhanded complaint okay but the 10+ "he dropped his town tell" posts based on one comment from me seems excessive.

Rb - people disagree with reasoning in mafia all the time.  Sometimes we're right, sometimes we're wrong.

author: Nachomamma8
content:
@Boonskiies -

First of all, I think that one of your major sticking points against Alisae is the way he's going about pushing you; I do agree that his reasoning for pushing you in general is weird as shit (saying that you're defending Frog and using that as a significant point against you when you're not defending Frog), but I'm having trouble seeing scum go so absolutely hard against you early game, especially when no one else is buying the push - the frustration here and here when it seems no one is buying into the push also seems pretty genuine to me. Him being scum here would require him being so desperate to get you lynched where he's willing to lie and throw fake tantrums to get you lynched, which doesn't really make sense to me. I think that it's more likely he's just town who got a bit overzealous with his read.

I also don't really get why Alisae as scum would move from Frogger to you if he were scum. If Alisae is scum and Frogger is town, then he has a perfectly acceptable mislynch wagon to sit on and moving from that to you (a read no one is really buying into and a read that's getting him scumread by multiple people) doesn't seem like it's in his best interests. If he is scum with Frogger, then I find the early mutual push kind of strange - I can see them maybe agreeing to push each other pregame but if that was the case, then I think Frogger would be pushing back more (this interaction looks more like Alisae pushing him and him rolling over).

Does that make sense?

author: Nachomamma8
content:
@Alisae - 

I don't really understand why you went from pushing Frog to Boonskies (and later implosion, but that seemed like it was more out of frustration than anything - correct me if I'm wrong). I don't think it's fair to say that Boonskies is hard defending Frogger; you seem to assume that from his 353 which I don't really understand - his only point was that he also has experience with Frog, it had nothing to do with whether he thought your experience was legitimate or not. Boonskiies's attack on you asking Gin to vote Frog just seems like a misunderstanding - I interpreted it as you trying to get a wagon on Frog early so you could read him but he seemed to read it as you trying to get Gin to vote Frog with absolutely no reasoning. Am I missing something with your push on him here?

As far as why I think he's town this game, I really liked this post for starters. I expected him to read people based on their pushes on him based on his perception of himself here, and the "I even gave you an out" post seemed like a smooth confidence that seemed unlikely to be coming from scum who was caught pretty much immediately and the sarcastic rebuttal of your suspicions in 327 and 328 also seemed town along that same vein. 

I also think that his suspicion on you makes a lot of sense: 313 picks up on the "OR ELSE" phrasing and calls you hypocritical for expecting an explanation from Frog when you haven't really explained your Frog read itself (understandable, a large part of confidence in your read on him is due to meta so it makes sense for someone to struggle to understand the push from an outside perspective), 323 is an attack founded by him having a different definition from the word "sort" than you do ("you're not reading me" is not necessarily the same as "you don't have a read on me" but a nuanced difference that isn't immediately noticeable), his 420 expresses that he doesn't like you accusing him of defending Frogger when that's not at all what he's doing (I agree with this - just because he disliked a certain push doesn't immediately mean he's defending the person you're pushing).

author: Nachomamma8
content:
@Titus:

I voted implosion for this, but it was a tongue in cheek vote; I had a different read on Tammy than he did but that had nothing to do with my read on him. I liked his read on me here but my townread on him didn't coalesce until this exchange; his position on Tammy seemed town to me because he was putting unreasonable pressure on someone who wasn't going to be a likely mislynch and I didn't think he'd do that as scum since he'd probably be expecting pushback from it which I don't think that he would be comfortable with.

From there, my read on him has only strengthened - this post adds a nuance to the Alisae scumread that I don't think he'd think to fake as scum, this post I'm probably townreading more than I should but it came after he voted Frogger immediately after I was thinking of asking him what he thought of Frogger, then thought to myself "man, if he's scum here I'm going to cry" and then refreshed the page and hey here's him with a similar read on me - I know it's not an insane thing to fake as scum and could be entirely coincidental but the feeling of being so perfectly in sync is too strong to shake, and the way his Alisae read is developing also seems genuine. 

I agree with 573 and mostly think that your point on him is misunderstanding what he said.

author: Nachomamma8
content: That makes sense. My slow starts are not intentional, I usually just find posting in the game more meaningful once there's things to analyze and more concrete posts to make but if I'm HYPED about a game it's not at all unnatural for me to hit the ground running; I think that capturing the ~feel~ of my early game posting is something I especially struggle with faking as scum but it's not like I haven't opened up a game spamming as scum before and I haven't seen too many people pick up on the differences.

author: Nachomamma8
content:
@Hikari Link, this is my second reads post talking about reads that I'm still working through.

I'm probably coming around to a townread on Gin. It does look like he's genuinely trying to read me through posts like 19 (which I lean town on because of the whole "unreasonable expectations thing" I talked about with my townread on implosion) and here where he questions my early activity even though not really thinking it makes me more likely to be scum. I'm inclined to read him for wacky shit like this post, where not pushing implosion today is apparently a gambit or this post where he's crumbed something to me or this "I don't give a shit about them or I do give a shit about them" separation + "I'm scumreading Tammy because my reasons for townreading her aren't deep enough" wacky shit combo but I'm far more comfortable reading him on the reads he's formed and decided to push and he just hasn't really gotten into that a whole lot yet.

---


Titus I just don't really have a read on right now. I had some concerns early mostly because I wasn't really sure where she was coming from and she was poking at a dynamic that felt off to her in a way that was more laid-back then I was expecting and then I ended up liking her responses to that but not in a way where I could feel so much as vaguely confident about a read there. I think pressing a scum read based on a contradiction that's not a contradiction is something she's capable of doing as either alignment.

---

I'm not really sure what to make of rb. His interactions with me bother me for reasons that I'd rather not get into, but at a minimum, I'm annoyed that he played one game with me 6 months ago and assumes he knows everything about me and I'm not worth interacting as a result, and I'm still trying to figure out whether I think that conclusion is genuine when he didn't bring up any of that frustration in the game in question.

I think his perspective on Frogger seems genuine; I'm not sure he'd be going to bat for a scumbuddy who hadn't done anything yet, and the way he presents his reasoning here like it's immediately going to be discredited seems genuine to me. His most recent point on Alisae (dropping strong Frogger meta scumread to push Boonskiies) is not bad at all and is easily the one thing about Alisae that bothers me. 

His interactions with Titus also look genuine enough and the things he's doing in general don't really look like things scum would do (in particular things like the self-vote and sheeping Titus stuff). If I didn't have the interactions stuff to parse through I'd be much more comfortable slotting him as town and he might just be town but as of right now I'm more comfortable leaving a bunch of question marks around him.

author: Nachomamma8
content:
@Hikari Link: This is my scumread on Frogger. A good chunk of my confidence in the read is because of meta (I wouldn't feel it was anything more than a decent RVS vote otherwise), but I've done my best to explain context and where I'm coming from below; let me know if anything needs to be clarified. 

First of all, in a vacuum, I feel like Frogger's posts aren't great. Voting Alisae is fine, but if it was a strong read like he claims it is in this post, I'd imagine he'd care a bit more about explaining it. Showing up and caring about nothing but the votecounts in this and this post while people are pushing a case on him and things are happening around him just feels unnatural.

The reason why meta makes this a read I feel somewhat confident about is because I've found that, in general, he'd rather be town than scum and it shows and I've also found that as town he's not inclined to let people just push him - he doesn't like being misunderstood and he generally feels very town when he's town and so usually struggles to see why people would suspect him. If you look through the first page of his ISO around this post, you'll see him responding to suspicion on him and pushing back a bit in a way that is much much different than how he's handling it here.

In Laundry Mafia, for example, Frogger played with Tammy and I and opened the game up in the same sort of way that we opened here; he was playful, he was active, he developed multiple reads and pushed them pretty much instantly.

There's also games like this one, where he was very busy but still managed to take point in a hydra and certainly didn't let the suspicion surrounding him stand while he flaked out of his scumgame that was going on at the same time.

I don't think that this is slam dunk reasoning or anything (it's possible that Frogger is town doing a weird gambit, it's possible he's just busy and not letting us know he is for some reason) and I think he's more than capable of faking the differences I pointed out in these game, but I think that him not liking scum as much as he likes town means that it's possible he's more inclined to have an opening like this when scum.

author: Fro99er
content:
First of all -- pregame -- I was asked by nancy not to spam or post way too much.  Anyway, I came to realize nancy wasn't just asking me, but asked everyone (I responded to nancy that I didn't like her assuming I would just spam this game...then she replied she sent it to everyone). That was confirmed in Alisae's first post (post 33) when Alisae said we were on a mission not to spam. So I'm trying to see if that's something I can actually do -- not post too much.

Even in my scum games I post a TON (Alisae will take note that I didn't post in our hydra game where we rolled scum, but I have a history of not posting in hydras as both alignments if I can't get into the game. In that game I really didn't want to play with ThinkBig -- who had just game thrown in Cabd's game -- and I signed up first then ThinkBig signed up and I didn't have a chance to tell Alisae I wanted out before the game started. Alisae convinced me to stay in, but I never posted but once until LyLo when I started fake posting as Alisae). 

I can link to multiple town and scum games where I just don't post in hydra, plus a third party game -- again...all as hydrae.

But when I roll scum solo, I post a fuckton. Need an example -- go see HoH where I was scum but still posted a shit ton, or my recent scum game with Eddie which was moderated by Ari: viewtopic.php?f=83&t=70624&activity_overview=1&sort_type=pc&sort_order=d

Anyway -- this is all setting up my points...

My first real scumread was Alisae, because I felt like Alisae was hopping on the convenient scumread of Implosion in 79. It came on the heels of Fire (post 56), rb (post 61), nacho (post 64) and Tammy (post 66) all either scumreading or being confused by Implosion's approach to the game around Tammy not towntelling yet. It just seemed weird.

Then Alisae continues to press the angle a bit (when I think, if I'm reading correctly, Implosion made it clear he was obviously joking around), and then responds with a mocking fake emotion post of Implosion in 97. I was also, like Implosion in post 98, not a fan of Alisae pressing the issue but not actually putting a vote on there when there was already a wagon there. I don't believe town!Alisae normally has a problem voting early wagons, so it seemed out of place for him not to vote Implosion who Alisae was implying was forcing an angle and forcing emotions.

Then when the pressure came off of Implosion (Tammy somewhat defends -- or at least tries to understand -- Implosion doing what he did in 99, nacho votes rb 100, rb self votes 101) suddenly Alisae backs off in post 106 and considers Implosion might not take that approach as scum.

If you don't feel he'd do that as scum, then why did you push EXACTLY THAT (I'm not talking the fake emotion part, but the "Tammy hasn't dropped my towntell yet" part, which is what you initially started your Implosion push with).

Anyway -- it gets worse. Boonskiies joines the rb wagon in post 105 and for whatever reason, Alisae jumps on Boon for that in post 116 asking Boon to explain the thought process behind the rb vote (It's pretty fucking clear Boon is having fun wagoning his buddy rb and I'm quite sure rb gets that too, but Alisae wants to turn everything into SUPER SERIOUS).

Then Alisae busts out the "Boon is faking emotion stuff" just like he did with Implosion, and mocks boon in 137 with a vote -- again taking what Boon did with his rb vote seriously. It feels so off. It's just accusations and not trying to understand any sort of dynamic between Boon and rb.

Anyway -- in 148 Alisae then responds to nacho by saying rb can "break up townreads and cause panic and chaos by sarcasticly discreditting everyone's towntells on people" as scum, but gut townreads rb anyway. rb then asks Alisae to explain the gut read and Alisae in 155 is like "I can't it's only 6 pages." My thinking here was "excuse me Alisae -- you've already been forming other reads in these first 6 pages and I know you're a tonal type player, so explain what about the tone makes you feel like rb is town instead of scum, since you think he can do this as both alignments."

Anyway, this is where I vote Alisae in 159

Alisae uses some AtE in 172. I'm not sure whether this is intentional or not. Alisae has seen me be pushed off reads through AtE before, and knows I'm normally all over the place as town -- so it didn't sit well with me. Then there's my AtE part of the brain that's going -- god I hope I'm not misreading Alisae. But -- I wanted to press on with my lack of posting, and I'm nowhere near convinced Alisae is town at this point, so I leave my vote.

Back to the Alisae Boon thing, because that's what comes up next in 189. Here Alisae makes it very clear he doesn't understand the Boon/rb dynamic, and accuses Boon of being scum loving to hop on a flashwagon. Funny thing, I've seen A LOT of town hop on early flashwagons too. There's like no consideration Boon could be town hopping on a flashwagon, and no consideration that Boon and rb might have a history together and are mafia friends.

rb makes the multiple Alisae vote in 194 as a joking response to Alisae mock asking to be flashwagoned, and since my scumread of Ali hasn't changed, I obviously jokingly fake hammer the fake L-1 in 198.

nacho voting me: Anyway -- now we get to where nacho votes me in 210. I honestly expected some votes given the intentional way I've played this game, and there's the first one. I can also see this coming from town nacho, given the two games I've ever played with him (Laundry and Nightman), I was very different from how I'm playing here. The problem comes later in his explanation...but we'll get to that.

post 220 rb says Alisae is so cute it hurts, and I a billion percent agree <3 (who's still reading?)

Anway, back to Alisae -- in post 218 Alisae discredits Boon saying that even rb knew Boon was joking. Again, no attempt to understand the dynamic, just assign a scum motivation to Boon. Also some more AtE at me.

THEN Alisae gives me the ultimatum in 234 -- FROG EXPLAIN YOURSELF OR ELSE DUN DUN DUNNNN. So obviously I reply with a vote on Alisae because I'm intentionally doing this to see how Alisae reacts (and oh yeah, I still scumread Alisae. At this point in time, the only thing that could be town that's going through my mind about Alisae is that maybe the emotion is legit and Alisae is just confbiasing on Boon and just finding way too many scum reads, which can definitely happen to town -- but mostly I still think Alisae is scum).

Alisae then does what I kind of expect, and votes me in post 244 and says I'm playing to my scum meta. I 100% expected Alisae -- AS EITHER ALIGNMENT --  to push me for not playing my town game because I'm NOT playing my town meta. Period. I'm being extremely blatant about NOT playing my town meta. Alisae says I never want to be wrong on him (100% true), and that I'm not trying to sort him (it appears 100% true, but that's only because I'm not typing out my thoughts around him. Indeed I'm trying to sort him and that's where some of these doubts keep running through my head -- more on that later), I'm not addressing Nacho's points (100% true, again I'm intentionally not because I'm trying to see if I can break my habits and be more analytical and less emotional with my posting, while also honoring nancy's request at the same time). Alisae is 100% correctly pushing me on a meta read, and has explained it very well and to a T. This facts around this push from Alisae are null.

What I think might NOT be null is the EMOTION behind it. I think Alisae as scum would be less EMOTIONAL about me playing to my scum meta, and more trying to prove a point. Here, Alisae really seems defeated that I'm (supposedly) not trying to sort him. This is evident further in post 333, 343, and 358. I really at this point doubt my Alisae read, and think all the earlier stuff might be Alisae confibiasing or just trying to hard to find scum. Seriously -- town!Alisae would definitely get frustrated that I'm (supposedly) not trying to read him, and scum!Alisae would almost surely just be like, "frog is scum and here's why" with less emotion behind it. That's my bet. And you know what... rb even solidifies my feelings around Alisae here with this

SCUM ALISAE WOULD EXPLAIN IT BETTER. I'm almost sure of it. Town Alisae would be really really emotive about this push on me.

Also -- Alisae shows more emotion and pissed off-ness about Boon NOT UNDERSTANDING Alisae's frog read of me in 394 with a vote. Oh hey, emotion 401. Anyway, the rest is Alisae going into a tunnel on Boon chainsawing. Still emotive. Alisae thinking Titus is scum, but then eventually being convinced by Titus to jump back on Implosion (this is stuff that happens to Ali as town).

So at this point...
UNVOTE: Alisae


Now I want to get back to some things Nacho said, that will tie in with the stuff I said at the top of this post...


@Nacho

SHOW ME WHERE I SAID THAT IN THE SIGN UP THREAD? SHOW IT TO ME. Because I went over to the sign up thread and here's EXACTLY what I sad.

Nowhere does that say I was hoping to roll town with you and Tammy. NOWHERE. Sure, it says I was excited about the player list. But you know what?! SOME THINGS HAVE HAPPENED that make me intentionally want to post less.

1) EVERY GAME I PLAY TURNS INTO ME POSTING 1000 TIMES
2) nancy specifically asked that I (which I found out was then "we") don't spam and shit up the thread. I like nancy. I want to honor her will
3) Alisae didn't look decent to me. Obviously I hadn't explained it because I was intentionally playing that way.

So I'd really like you to explain how you changed my sign up post from what I ACTUALLY posted, to it being something about you and tammy all being town together. Be my guest.

Also this...



GUESS WHAT. I DIDNT CARE THAT WHAT I WAS DOING LOOKED SCUMMY. I KNEW IT WOULD. THIS IS EXACTLY WHAT I WENT FOR.



Explain to me what is scummy about wanting the wagon counts correctly when I'm trying to induce a wagon on myself. I was 100% hoping Alisae would eventually vote me so I could get a more firm read on Alisae, and I have. I think Alisae is town. This gives us TWO wagons to analyze -- the wagon on me, and the one on Alisae  (there's also a third on Implosion, which doesn't directly have to do with my gambit here). I think mine is more scum motivated than Alisae's was, because I'm the easy fucking mislynch here who is intentionally playing like easy mislynch bait. People attacking Alisae are doing so correctly in that they THINK Alisae isn't explaining the read on me very well, but guess what...there isn't a whole lot TO explain when all I'm doing is posting "VOTE: Alisae" and correcting vote counts. And I still think Alisae actually DID explain the read on me well. It's a 100% accurate meta read on me that I knew was coming, and it's explained perfectly if you know my town meta.

Problem is, there is a bit of scum meta read that Alisae isn't accounting for, and that it's "I still post a shit fucking ton" as scum. Go look up my post counts in HoH (large normal archive) and in Vanilluxe (Ari's game in the micro forum, not archived yet). So Alisae was right about me in that many of the things I did ARE my scum meta -- except this thing I'm doing now by not posting at all is 100% NOT my scum meta.

And this is also where I bring up the fact that Alisae would normally point out I didn't post in White Flag Mafia at all as scum. BUT that was IN A HYDRA with Alisae, and I have a history of not posting in Hydra as ALL alignments. Again -- if you need links for me doing this as town, I'll do so. I also had other reasons to not get into the White Flag game as mentioned at the top of this post.

So now...back to you Nacho -- explain to me why my being concerned about getting the correct votes on the correct people, in the correct order is scummy.

ISN'T THAT EXACLTY WHAT I'M DOING? I'm literally taking actions that have a high chance of making me look like garbage because I DON'T CARE to get scumread. I WANTED to get scumread, and act differently, to see exactly who would wagon me and for what reason, and who would counterwagon who, and for what reason.

That's why I told Tammy "you'll see". Because I WANT this wagon analysis for later. ESPECIALLY in a Titus game if Titus is town. I'm going back and forth on Titus in my head, but I think she's more likely town. The main part that concerns me is her pushing Alisae back on Implosion, but that could just be Titus trying to work together with someone she townreads to push a scumread of hers. Most of the other things Titus has done I believe are town.

Anyway -- all this said, I still think you're probably town and Implosion is the scum voting my wagon? The reason why I think you're town is post 640. You say it's a meta-based read, and again, you've correctly read some of the things. But not all the things. You missed my flaked hydra games as town. You've missed the fact that I flaked out in that Alisae game because I DIDNT WANT TO PLAY WITH THINK BIG. I'll go show you the damn Hydra thread. I never even actually got INTO the game. I take the lead in all my Bella hydras, because BELLA IS NEVER THERE. If there's someone just as active as me, then I usually take a back seat. Go look at the games I took a back seat in.

1) With Mollie (town and scum games)
2) With Alisae (scum)
3) With Metal Sonic (town)
4) With Plotinus (third party)

ALL of those names are ACTIVE posters, and sometimes I feel like if they are active enough, they can just carry the workload if they don't mind (and in the case of the Alisae scum hydra where I took a back seat, it was because I didn't want to play with ThinkBig, who again signed up AFTER I did knowing he shouldn't have signed up with me, but the game started before I noticed and had a chance to notify the mod I wouldn't play with TB for the bullshit game throwing he pulled in Cabd's game).

In Laundry I pulled another gambit. I intentionally tried to look scummy in a different way and Tammy jumped on me for it. This time I'm taking an opposite approach thanks to nancy wanting this game to be less toxic and spammy (and so far this game has been fun to read, and there's no toxicity which is awesome).

So I don't expect you to be able to fully comprehend what I'm doing without the full picture of all my hydra games.

I also think you're town because of this

you can actually see a different perspective, and what you're saying here is exactly what I was going for. I didn't want to let people know, because

1) I wanted to honor nancy's request to not spam or be toxic
2) I wanted to see reactions and wagons to my play
3) I wanted to meta break a bit because it's so damn divisive
4) I want to take a bit of a backseat approach and see if that helps my game, because I feel like I'm getting worse over the last several games
5) And most importantly because I wanted to be able to sort Alisae. Sounds dumb? Yeah, but sorting Alisae is always my #1 priority because BFFs.

No, I'm not mad. I am emotive. I'm being emphatic. I'm GLAD you're pushing this. I'm GLAD I think you're town and Alisae is town. But god damn some of the things you've said are pretty damn wrong and even confusing or simply incorrect or made up (like my sign-up post). I'm GLAD we built up two wagons based off my play here. That was my intent.



Anyway -- I think rb is town. I think Boon is town. I think Implosion might be scum? I don't have a read on Tammy. I think Titus might be town? I find that it being early in the game means that I'm more comfortable with having townreads for little to no reason than I would have been later in the game, and I think that's what Alisae meant - he didn't really have a great way of explaining his rb read right then but it was early game so no big deal.

author: TheRealGin-N-Tonic
content:
Spoiler: Let's take a look at me 


So starting off in 683, Frog asked me why his vote was scummy. Let us not forget post 679 is me literally picking a fight with him. I was begging for a fight there. Back to 683, I gave a detailed response to Frog in what my concerns were and this post establishes that I'm not just here to whine, but to actually discuss the reasoning behind the statements.




This post is, while sassy, drives home the point that I'm trying to get Frog to understand our miscommunication. The main argument was that Frog thought I used incorrect meta to justify a scum read on him in some shape or form. I first start off by disproving this theory by asking him to look for the part where he voted me. If there is no vote, then that one point of the theory is gone.



This is the next step in dissolving the theory of scum!me to Frog as the part I needed him to understand was that I ALSO didn't use it to form a scum read or shade his slot.



This is then a question that I put in lower-case for viewing pleasure.  This question represents me now digging into Frogs read, I'm not pushing him away, but actively sorting him while asking meaningful questions.

The p-edit shows myself trying to make the message clear what I'm claiming vs what he thinks of me.



Now, I have to admit, why you assume I tried to yell at Frog just to lay him off me is making me scratch my head if you read posts like post 700 because that is in actual words, no hidden meaning, I wanted to argue with you and Frog. I wasn't trying to hide or anything.



This is another question by me that should strike you as "Gin is trying to sort Frog's slot." Right here I'm digging at Frog to see if he truly believes what 'I did' would come from scum. I'm trying to find out what Frog's motives are.



This quote pyramid is another example of me trying to get Frog to answer a question that I really wanted an answer too. If I truly wanted Frog to lay off me, why then would I keep trying to bring points back up for us to argue more? That is counterproductive to what you're claiming I tried to do.




Now we're down to the final juice bits of the argument and we get down to where Frog and I have reached the point of talking past each other enough that we've come full circle and we can look at each to say what we think.



At the very end, I finally get to the point with Frog where we fully understand each other. I know his concerns and he thought I made a shoddy excuse to vote Frog. But wait there's more.

I was able to prove to Frog that I not only didnt use the incorrect meta to cast a vote on him, but I was also able to prove through persistent communication that I also didn't use the meta to even cast shade or scum read him. 


In conclusion, I truly tried to solve the issue with Frog instead of just yell him away. Therefore, your theory as to me being scum trying to yell him away is no longer valid. Of course you're welcome to give your interpretation of each post and say how I wasn't actually trying to work with Frog to resolve an issue but it's simply not the case here.

author: Prism
content:
Originally I had typed up a long post detailing an informal contract in order to keep myself engaged and accountable but I think it's too dramatic of a step. Instead of laying out a bunch of arbitrary rules for myself to stick to I'm going to lay out my goals for this game openly and ask you to intervene if you see that I am not fulfilling them. The incentive for calling me out if I am not will soon be obvious.

My largest goal for this game is to maintain my own morale and stay engaged with the game straight through. I have formed the bad habit of becoming extremely apathetic and failing to pull my fair share workwise, be it reading or explaining, after a hot start. Specifically, I have a bad habit of making promises I fail to keep, that I will post when I get home, that I will read X person when I have the time, etc., only to think that it can wait for a time when I'm more enthusiastic about the game. I have paid dearly for this repeatedly and have singlehandedly lost my team the game multiple times with my own laziness.

I think one thing I need to learn is that enthusiasm is something created from doing the reading and engaging to begin with, that it's fundamentally a positive cycle. In other words, making the attempt to engage leads to more enthusiasm and engagement, while avoidance leads to more apathy and avoidance. If you at all see me shying away, please call me out and reel me back in.

I realize the optimal entry post is to immediately dive in and give reads, however this is something that's extremely important to me and I strongly feel that laying it out at the very start, publicly, is the best way to dedicate myself to it and give me something to point back to. (Admittedly I'm also just very tired, know I can't read tonight, and know I'm therefore already in danger of falling into the cycle, and think this is a good way to ensure that doesn't happen) Catchup starts during my commute tomorrow.

author: Nachomamma8
content:
Early game, I wanted to start a chucklefuck wagon on him to see if I worry him about being lynched early a bit. People didn't end up taking the bait, so no dice there. When he ignored the push on me immediately, I played up the scumread on him to get him respond but still didn't really get anything substantial. This post is me exploring my concern that he was begging for people to pay attention to him without anything substantial to say. Here I prodded him on his attempt to sort me; I didn't think "why are you so active and town???" was a valid question, so I made him explain why he was asking it. I was satisfied with his explanation. This is me prodding at him for making a big show of interacting with me and sorting me but still not actually sorting me. This is me urging for him to talk about the reads I generated, to get some more content on the table - I followed up with it when he didn't respond shortly after, but stopped pursuing it because the discussion with Frogger was along the lines of what I was looking for. 

Your case against me here seems to be that because I'm not voting him, I'm not sorting him, but that simply isn't true - Gin in particular I'm willing to give some room (and I'm far more interested in what he does outside of interactions with me anyways so it's not like pressing him is going to help with that) - I also haven't found problems with his positions or his reasoning at all, I've just had a problem with him not scumhunting hard enough yet which is a fairly nebulous concern and not exactly something I can just make him do, especially since we're still in a fairly early stage of the game.


Why do you think Gin would random vote us randomly if we were all partners together? Do you think his motivation there is so he can point to those naked votes down the road and say that we aren't partners together or do you think he simply feels the need to remind us that he's our scumbuddy?


Not everything that you do in a mafia game is intentional. Sometimes, you get frustrated and engaged in a shitshow fight despite the best intentions not to, and sometimes you end up lurking despite not believing that it at all helps your win condition. In this specific situation, I had reason to believe that Frogger had a strong preference for town over scum, and I had strong reason to believe that he was the type of person who got drawn into addressing pushes on him as town (and I explained where I was coming from in this belief). I believed that there was a possibility that Frogger was demoralized on drawing scum because he wanted to solve the game with his friends and as a result was having trouble forcing himself to post - there was a possibility that something else was going on but I strongly believed that if I was right, he wouldn't be able to shake my pressure off him even once he was able to get some posts together and the idea he was caught and he had to dig himself out of a hole would make his job harder - if I was wrong, Frogger as town has been extremely comfortable when responding to pressure and I wasn't worried that I'd mislynch him for that reasoning. 


Spoiler: â™¥ 


~ I'm flattered. Think they want some company? ~ Spoiler: â™¥

author: Nachomamma8
content:
I find it disingenuous that you're pretending that there's just no way that I can have a townread on Alisae even though I strongly disagreed with his case because I saw a lack of scum motivation in his posting when "it doesn't have scum motivation" is the same reason you thought that my attack on Frogger was off. I explained before (and I'm not sure what you disagreed with as far as my explanation goes), but I don't think it makes sense for Alisae to go full rambo on Frogger then drop Frogger and go full rambo on Boonskiies in such a short amount of time; as scum, he's risking making a number of enemies and alienating himself from townies for basically no reason - I also think that Frogger's point about emotional attachment to pushes is a good one; from my experience with him, Alisae as town early can get a bit overzealous in pushes and overextend himself in some of his pushes but when I'm seen him as town he's usually a hell of a lot more reasonable about it.


This is not a valid argument - I'm playing a game where I'm supposed to psychic out whether other people's role PMs are green or red - there's always a very large chance I'm wrong at any given moment but that doesn't mean that it's not worth it to pursue my suspicions anyways. 


I've very recently put my thoughts into a "state of the game" post - I'm not posting another one until I have reads on Prism, you, Aristophanes, Hikari Link, and Frogger that are a little more substantive.

author: Nachomamma8
content:
Keyser, I am a sucker for people who suspect me when I'm being townread and your position on me is no exception - there are plenty of games where I'm sort of phoning it in early game and I feel like I might get mislynched and this doesn't really feel like the case here. That's mitigated somewhat by your reasoning. Your position on my early Frogger reads seems a bit unbelievable to me, for example; if I am scum and making a push on a townie who is gambitting, I know that he's not getting mislynched because eventually the gambit will break and my push will be invalidated - thus it doesn't seem incredibly opportunistic to push him unless I really believe he's having a really off game (in which case the narrative where I'm town who thinks he might be scum makes a lot of sense to me). I also don't really understand why you're pushing back as hard against my Alisae townread as you are but not giving Frogger's a sidelong glance; I understand that's probably because Frogger's demonstrated a lot more doubt than I have, but I would think that someone who was scumreading Alisae but later started townreading him would factor into your overall read but it just didn't. 

The big concern I have for your catchup posts is the concern Alisae and Tammy have already expressed; it feels like you decided what reads you'd have before you started catching up. It might be because of format and I might have missed something, but every comment you've made on Me/Gin/Alisae (with the exception of a single Alisae point) has been negative and every comment you've made on everyone else, and that seems unnatural to me. I think that it's natural to doubt yourself and doubt your reads in a game of this nature, and while it's completely possible that you're just a bit confbiased as town I can see a very clear picture where you as scum form three main scumreads because that's how many scum you're looking for and then making a narrative from there.

I do appreciate you catching up as quickly as you did, know that it couldn't have been easy and if there's anything you're looking for from me in particular let me know.

author: Hikari Link
content:
Yes, I'm aware of that. Like you, I'm still catching up to the game. Unlike you though, I'm consolidating everything into one large post that will show how I read the game when everything is all said and done. I've done so much skipping around at this point that I can't give an accurate read of a specific section like you and Keyser can. So you let me do my thing and I'll let you do yours.

In the meantime, I want to socialize with people where possible. Playing well isn't my only goal here though.  I'm genuinely hoping that I can make some friends in this game, since this seems like a group of cool people. In addition, I don't want to be perceived as a flake, because it hurts my chances of making friends, so I'm letting people know that I'm putting effort towards this game and I legitimately care. I feel it's especially important after earlier where I almost replaced out. And please, nobody read into this paragraph as indication of my alignment one way or the other. I want to be clear that these are my genuine feelings. I'm not great at expressing my inner feelings in subtle or nuanced ways, so I'm just speaking out.

author: Hikari Link
content:
I'm very sorry if it seemed that way, it was definitely not my intent. I know autism is used as an insult on the internet and I didn't mean it in a disparaging way. I have nothing but respect for all people. I'm a Psych major (though developmental disorders aren't my field of expertise) and my understanding is that autism is typically characterized by difficulty with social interactivity. I was just saying that I, personally, I'm not on the autism spectrum (to my knowledge), I'm just an awkward person. Again, sorry if anyone felt offended.


Yeah, this post could be construed as unrelated too, so I'll just say that this was so people don't have a negative bias towards me because they think I am someone who is insensitive towards those with developmental disorders.

author: Prism
content:
Heads up that I'm on my phone so the citations for this post could use some work. These thoughts are also based off of my thoughts from reading ~14 hours ago so they might be slightly inaccurate-I've tried to signal where my memory is less confident. After typing it up and editing it a few times it's also a bit scattered, but I would say my point about Boonskies's reaction to Alisae is the most important part for people. My comments on Nacho are more for him. Unfortunately that's become par for the course and that needs to change.

I'm only up to the mid 20s right now but I'm having a lot of problems with Nacho so far. His read on Boonskies from that time is a major stretch. Boon's early vote on rb was the only thing I found town about him, and his reaction to the Alisae dayvig was really bad in my opinion. It was very transparently focused on saying "Haha I'm town" to Alisae for no apparent reason-why say "Well I'm town so you're dead good job" and leave it at that? It seems to me as though he'd make more of an attempt to get more of Alisae rather than simply fingerwag that they'll die because he (Boon) was town. Let Alisae's death be the one to say "I told you so." It reads as a major failure to a pretty transparent reaction test.

VOTE: Boonskies for now.

I believe there was more to it but townread came off really contrived and so did his read evolution on Gin. I have a lot more to say about reading Nacho and my current thoughts on him but a big subset of those are better saved for 15-20 pages down the line.

I don't know what I liked about Titus but I did. I also liked the look of Frogger push that happened early on. I use "look" because it appeared to require meta verification.

Aristo's comment that it was only 4/5 hours also threw me for a massive loop and I think provided much-needed context for why those first ~20ish pages were all over the place. Then again, as I said I'm really poor at reading for alignment with a replace in so maybe that's more me trying to shift blame from myself instead of just taking responsibility for my flaws.

author: Prism
content:
Also, it is likely I won't be able to post later today or Saturday. I will have very limited internet access and possibly none at all. A big part of why I'm settling for my inarticulate, scattered, and largely first kneejerk reactions there is because I knew that it is unlikely I can contribute again until Sunday, making it important to set a pace for myself to jump back into.

The most visceral impression I've had from what I've read, and what I want more input on from others, still comes from Boonskies's reaction to Alisae and I think that anyone town reading him should reconsider. Perhaps something has happened since but that reaction seemed plainly fake to me and I'm unable to empathize with the positive reception it got.
